alert.note: Alert for Robertson; Sumner (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 28 at 7:44AM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Middle Tennessee, including the following counties, Robertson and Sumner. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 742 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Areas in Portland and White House, and the South Fork Red River including Orlinda, Cross Plains, and Lamont. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Springfield, White House, Portland, Cross Plains and Orlinda. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
